Key Arguments: The legislation is unconstitutional and violates freedom of speech as per the Commonwealth Constitution and the Bill of Human Rights.
The proposed legislation is political in nature and aims to impose laws over people, which is not permissible.
Laws should apply equally to all people, and the proposed legislation discriminates between different groups.
The concepts of misinformation and disinformation are dismissed as fabricated; truth and lies should be discerned through free debate.
Politicians and the press are deemed the most untrustworthy sources of information.
Existing laws already address issues like defamatory speech, making the new legislation unnecessary.
The bill is considered discriminatory and therefore unlawful.
Notable Quotes: No laws can be made with regard to freedom of speech in accordance with the Commonwealth Constitution and the Bill of Human Rights.
There is no such thing as misinformation or disinformation and these are just made up words.
At this point in time, the most untrustworthy information is coming from the politicians and the press.
